4/5 – Evil Avatar

About This Game

Defy Gravity is an action platformer that is a mix between classic platforming and gravity based puzzle solving. Kara, our heroine, has access to a unique gameplay mechanic that she uses to manipulate the world around her. She has a gun that is able to alter the laws of physics through the creation of pockets of gravity and anti-gravity. By mastering the use of these abilities Kara is able to augment her jump in order to almost fly past obstacles. These powers can also be utilized to move objects that block her path and platforms that Kara stands on in order to traverse the levels.

Key Features:

  • Unique physics engine that provides a never before experienced gameplay experience.
  • Xbox controller and keyboard/mouse support
  • 24 unique levels
  • A second quest mode that radically changes the game and adds an additional 24 levels
  • Custom Soundtrack
  • 8 Steam Achievements
READ MORE

System Requirements

    • OS: Windows XP/Vista/7
    • Processor: 1.5Ghz
    • Memory: 512Mb
    • Hard Disk Space: 50Mb
    • Video Card: 128 MB Graphics Card that supports Shader Model 1.1
    • DirectX®: 9.0c

Defy Gravity really only does one thing wrong. It undersells itself, look past the graphics and you'll find this gem of a puzzle platformer and you'll experience quite a gratifying sensation once you beat it. So why not pick the game up and add it to your library, you might just be taken aback with what you find.

BLACKxMETANK
379 products in account
63 reviews
Recommended
1.5 hrs on record
Posted: October 31
Defy Gravity Extended it's an indie game based in physics / gravity laws. It could looks like a horrible game.

I mean art and animations are simple and it can feels empty, otherwise it's too challenging.

You can feel that it's a 2D version of "Portal", you have a gun that has two functions, repel and attract.

Something that i loved in this game was the relaxing background music that makes you relax during stressful levels.

It has enough good levels and after finish it the nightmare haven't finished yet, you have to complete it twice in order to get all achievements, something that will make you rage.

It's always on discount (95% off i guess), so if your style it's the challenges you can give it a chance.

7.5 / 10

If you found this review helpful you can find out more at our Completing the Backlog's Curator page.

JoeyRock
341 products in account
2 reviews
Recommended
2.6 hrs on record
Posted: August 4
This game was a lot of fun and very reminiscent of the early 2000s online flash games, which gave me a wonderful nostalgic feeling all throughout the game. This puzzle-platformer is straightforward, however reaching your end goal can and will be difficult. The simplicity and correct execution of this game's design creates that unique feeling, where the player knows finishing this level is solely due to the player’s ability to perform. No game exploits, no grinding to get to a certain level or luck driven events.
Just simple, skill-based levels with original and adaptive gameplay.

Granted that not everyone is into 2D flash puzzle-platformers, this game may not be what everyone is looking for, however if you do purchase this game and give it the time of day, I think you might be pleasantly surprised at how much fun you'll have.

Extra - The authentic soundtrack is very atmospheric and enjoyable.
